p: The air-dried powdered aerial parts of S. macrosiphon (1.8 kg) were crushed and extracted with methanol (8 × 8 L) at room temperature for 7 days. The extract was concentrated under vacuum to afford dark green gummy residue (90.0 g). The crude methanol extract was mixed with water (700 mL) to form a suspension and partitioned successively with n-hexane, chloroform and ethyl acetate to yield n-hexane (40.0 g), chloroform (20.0 g), ethyl acetate (4.0 g) and water soluble (26.0 g) fractions.
